channel.title: CVE Feed for paytiumsupport -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for paytiumsupport -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-7287|2024-10-16T16:02:28.943Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized subscription cancellation due to a missing capability check on the pt_cancel_subscription function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to cancel a subscription to the plugin.

item.title: CVE-2023-7291|2024-10-16T06:43:43.626Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the create_mollie_account function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to set up a mollie account.

item.title: CVE-2023-7287|2024-10-16T06:43:24.306Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized subscription cancellation due to a missing capability check on the pt_cancel_subscription function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to cancel a subscription to the plugin.

item.title: CVE-2023-7290|2024-10-16T06:43:41.271Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the check_for_verified_profiles function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to check profile statuses.

item.title: CVE-2023-7293|2024-10-16T06:43:46.043Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the check_mollie_account_details function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to verify the existence of a mollie account.

item.title: CVE-2023-7294|2024-10-16T06:43:46.535Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized data modification due to a missing capability check on the create_mollie_profile function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to create a mollie payment profile.

item.title: CVE-2023-7288|2024-10-16T06:43:26.248Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized data modification due to a missing capability check on the update_profile_preference function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to change plugin settings.

item.title: CVE-2023-7289|2024-10-16T06:43:39.840Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized API key update due to a missing capability check on the paytium_sw_save_api_keys function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to change plugin API keys.

item.title: CVE-2023-7292|2024-10-16T06:43:45.569Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized notification dismissal due to a missing capability check on the paytium_notice_dismiss function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to dismiss admin notices.

item.title: CVE-2023-7294|2024-10-16T15:07:42.579Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized data modification due to a missing capability check on the create_mollie_profile function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to create a mollie payment profile.

item.title: CVE-2023-7291|2024-10-16T15:29:24.633Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the create_mollie_account function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to set up a mollie account.

item.title: CVE-2023-7293|2024-10-16T15:12:28.957Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the check_mollie_account_details function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to verify the existence of a mollie account.

item.title: CVE-2023-7288|2024-10-16T15:32:34.534Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized data modification due to a missing capability check on the update_profile_preference function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to change plugin settings.

item.title: CVE-2023-7292|2024-10-16T15:28:26.163Z -- paytiumsupport -- paytium%3A%20mollie%20payment%20forms%20%26%20donations
item.description: The Paytium: Mollie payment forms & donations plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized notification dismissal due to a missing capability check on the paytium_notice_dismiss function in versions up to, and including, 4.3.7. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to dismiss admin notices.
